question: Question_A_12
sols:
These commands have the following effects, in sequence:

"A = zeros(2,3);" creates a matrix of zeroes having 2 rows and 3
columns. "A(1,1) = 2;" changes the value in the first row, first column
entry to 2. "A(2,3) = 3;" changes the value in the second row, third
column entry to 3.

The result is the following matrix, "A".

\[A = \left[\begin{array}{ccc} 2 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 3\end{array}\right]\]
hints:
What is the dimension of \emph{A}? All entries of \emph{A} are initially
zero. Which entries are then changed in line 2 and 3?
